org.tests.data

Class StringPreprocessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tests.data.StringPreprocessor

  • public class StringPreprocessor
extends java.lang.Object
    Transforms strings from one language culture to another. Important since all internal (i.e. java) string representation is in English.
    Author:
    David

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StringPreprocessor() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Runs a example that replaces the decimal points in a formula string formatted with German culture to English.
      static ExquisiteAppXML processForImport(ExquisiteAppXML appXML, DiagnosisConfiguration config)
      Changes string representation of formulae into a string culture understandable in java e.g. decimal points as "." etc.
      static java.lang.String replaceDecimalPoints(java.lang.String targetString, java.util.Locale currentLocale, java.util.Locale targetLocale)
      Checks a formula for decimal points and replaces with the decimal point symbol specified by the locale.
      static java.lang.String replaceDelimiter(java.lang.String targetFormula, java.util.Locale currentLocale, java.util.Locale targetLocale)
      Replaces function parameter delimiter (e.g. for Excel function parameters)

      • processForImport

        public static ExquisiteAppXML processForImport(ExquisiteAppXML appXML,
                               DiagnosisConfiguration config)
        Changes string representation of formulae into a string culture understandable in java e.g. decimal points as "." etc.
        Parameters:
        appXML - - the ExquisiteAppXML object sent from a client.
        Returns:
        - the same ExquisiteAppXML but with modified content.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
